levels.title: API-only XSS
levels.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> without using the frontend application at all. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
You need to work with the server-side API directly. Try different HTTP verbs on different entities exposed through the API.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xss.html#perform-a-persisted-xss-attack-without-using-the-frontend-application-at-all

levels.title: Access Log
levels.description: Gain access to any access log file of the server.
levels.hint:
Who would want a server access log to be accessible through a web application?
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#gain-access-to-any-access-log-file-of-the-server

levels.title: Admin Registration
levels.description: Register as a user with administrator privileges.
levels.hint:
You have to assign the unassignable.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/improper-input-validation.html#register-as-a-user-with-administrator-privileges

levels.title: Admin Section
levels.description: Access the administration section of the store.
levels.hint:
It is just slightly harder to find than the score board link.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-access-control.html#access-the-administration-section-of-the-store

levels.title: Arbitrary File Write
levels.description: Overwrite the Legal Information file. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
Look out for a tweet praising new functionality of the web shop. Then find a third party vulnerability associated with it.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/vulnerable-components.html#overwrite-the-legal-information-file

levels.title: Bjoern's Favorite Pet
levels.description: Reset the password of Bjoern's OWASP account via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
He might have spoilered it on at least one occasion where a camera was running. Maybe elsewhere as well.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-authentication.html#reset-the-password-of-bjoerns-owasp-account-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism

levels.title: Blockchain Hype
levels.description: Learn about the Token Sale before its official announcement.
levels.hint:
The developers truly believe in "Security through Obscurity" over actual access restrictions.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/security-through-obscurity.html#learn-about-the-token-sale-before-its-official-announcement

levels.title: Blocked RCE DoS
levels.description: Perform a Remote Code Execution that would keep a less hardened application busy forever. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
The feature you need to exploit for this challenge is not directly advertised anywhere.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/insecure-deserialization.html#perform-a-remote-code-execution-that-would-keep-a-less-hardened-application-busy-forever

levels.title: CAPTCHA Bypass
levels.description: Submit 10 or more customer feedbacks within 10 seconds.
levels.hint:
After finding a CAPTCHA bypass, write a script that automates feedback submission. Or open many browser tabs and be really quick.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-anti-automation.html#submit-10-or-more-customer-feedbacks-within-10-seconds

levels.title: Change Bender's Password
levels.description: Change Bender's password into slurmCl4ssic without using SQL Injection or Forgot Password.
levels.hint:
In previous releases this challenge was wrongly accused of being based on CSRF.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-authentication.html#change-benders-password-into-slurmcl4ssic-without-using-sql-injection-or-forgot-password

levels.title: Christmas Special
levels.description: Order the Christmas special offer of 2014.
levels.hint:
Find out how the application handles unavailable products and try to find a loophole.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#order-the-christmas-special-offer-of-2014

levels.title: CSP Bypass
levels.description: Bypass the Content Security Policy and perform an XSS attack with <script>alert(`xss`)</script> on a legacy page within the application. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
What is even "better" than a legacy page with a homegrown RegEx sanitizer? Having CSP injection issues on the exact same page as well!
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xss.html#bypass-the-content-security-policy-and-perform-an-xss-attack-on-a-legacy-page

levels.title: Client-side XSS Protection
levels.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> bypassing a client-side security mechanism. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
Only some input fields validate their input. Even less of these are persisted in a way where their content is shown on another screen.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xss.html#perform-a-persisted-xss-attack-bypassing-a-client-side-security-mechanism

levels.title: Confidential Document
levels.description: Access a confidential document.
levels.hint:
Analyze and tamper with links in the application that deliver a file directly.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#access-a-confidential-document

levels.title: DOM XSS
levels.description: Perform a DOM XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)">.
levels.hint:
Look for an input field where its content appears in the HTML when its form is submitted.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xss.html#perform-a-dom-xss-attack

levels.title: Database Schema
levels.description: Exfiltrate the entire DB schema definition via SQL Injection.
levels.hint:
Find out where this information could come from. Then craft a UNION SELECT attack string against an endpoint that offers an unnecessary way to filter data.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#exfiltrate-the-entire-db-schema-definition-via-sql-injection

levels.title: Deprecated Interface
levels.description: Use a deprecated B2B interface that was not properly shut down.
levels.hint:
The developers who disabled the interface think they could go invisible by just closing their eyes.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/security-misconfiguration.html#use-a-deprecated-b2b-interface-that-was-not-properly-shut-down

levels.title: Easter Egg
levels.description: Find the hidden easter egg.
levels.hint:
If you solved one of the three file access challenges, you already know where to find the easter egg.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-access-control.html#find-the-hidden-easter-egg

levels.title: Email Leak
levels.description: Perform an unwanted information disclosure by accessing data cross-domain.
levels.hint:
Try to find and attack an endpoint that responds with user information. SQL Injection is not the solution here.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#perform-an-unwanted-information-disclosure-by-accessing-data-cross-domain

levels.title: Ephemeral Accountant
levels.description: Log in with the (non-existing) accountant acc0unt4nt@juice-sh.op without ever registering that user.
levels.hint:
Try to create the needed user "out of thin air".
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#log-in-with-the-non-existing-accountant-without-ever-registering-that-user

levels.title: Error Handling
levels.description: Provoke an error that is neither very gracefully nor consistently handled.
levels.hint:
Try to submit bad input to forms. Alternatively tamper with URL paths or parameters.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/security-misconfiguration.html#provoke-an-error-that-is-neither-very-gracefully-nor-consistently-handled

levels.title: Expired Coupon
levels.description: Successfully redeem an expired campaign coupon code.
levels.hint:
Try to identify past special event or holiday campaigns of the shop first.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/improper-input-validation.html#successfully-redeem-an-expired-campaign-coupon-code

levels.title: Extra Language
levels.description: Retrieve the language file that never made it into production.
levels.hint:
Brute force is not the only option for this challenge, but a perfectly viable one.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-anti-automation.html#retrieve-the-language-file-that-never-made-it-into-production

levels.title: Five-Star Feedback
levels.description: Get rid of all 5-star customer feedback.
levels.hint:
Once you found admin section of the application, this challenge is almost trivial.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-access-control.html#get-rid-of-all-5-star-customer-feedback

levels.title: Forged Coupon
levels.description: Forge a coupon code that gives you a discount of at least 80%.
levels.hint:
Try either a) a knowledgable brute force attack or b) reverse engineering or c) some research in the cloud.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/cryptographic-issues.html#forge-a-coupon-code-that-gives-you-a-discount-of-at-least-80

levels.title: Forged Feedback
levels.description: Post some feedback in another users name.
levels.hint:
You can solve this by tampering with the user interface or by intercepting the communication with the RESTful backend.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-access-control.html#post-some-feedback-in-another-users-name

levels.title: Forged Review
levels.description: Post a product review as another user or edit any user's existing review.
levels.hint:
Observe the flow of product review posting and editing and see if you can exploit it.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-access-control.html#post-a-product-review-as-another-user-or-edit-any-users-existing-review

levels.title: Forged Signed JWT
levels.description: Forge an almost properly RSA-signed JWT token that impersonates the (non-existing) user rsa_lord@juice-sh.op.
levels.hint:
This challenge is explicitly not about acquiring the RSA private key used for JWT signing.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/vulnerable-components.html#forge-an-almost-properly-rsa-signed-jwt-token

levels.title: Forgotten Developer Backup
levels.description: Access a developer's forgotten backup file.
levels.hint:
You need to trick a security mechanism into thinking that the file you want has a valid file type.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#access-a-developers-forgotten-backup-file

levels.title: Forgotten Sales Backup
levels.description: Access a salesman's forgotten backup file.
levels.hint:
You need to trick a security mechanism into thinking that the file you want has a valid file type.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#access-a-salesmans-forgotten-backup-file

levels.title: Frontend Typosquatting
levels.description: Inform the shop about a typosquatting imposter that dug itself deep into the frontend. (Mention the exact name of the culprit)
levels.hint:
This challenge has nothing to do with mistyping web domains. There is no conveniently misplaced file helping you with this one either. Or is there?
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/vulnerable-components.html#inform-the-shop-about-a-typosquatting-imposter-that-dug-itself-deep-into-the-frontend

levels.title: GDPR Data Erasure
levels.description: Log in with Chris' erased user account.
levels.hint:
Turns out that something is technically and legally wrong with the implementation of the "right to be forgotten" for users.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-authentication.html#log-in-with-chris-erased-user-account

levels.title: GDPR Data Theft
levels.description: Steal someone else's personal data without using Injection.
levels.hint:
Trick the regular Data Export to give you more than actually belongs to you.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#steal-someone-elses-personal-data-without-using-injection

levels.title: HTTP-Header XSS
levels.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> through an HTTP header. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
Finding a piece of displayed information that could originate from an HTTP header is part of this challenge.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xss.html#perform-a-persisted-xss-attack-through-an-http-header

levels.title: Imaginary Challenge
levels.description: Solve challenge #999. Unfortunately, this challenge does not exist.
levels.hint:
You need to trick the hacking progress persistence feature into thinking you solved challenge #999.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/cryptographic-issues.html#solve-challenge-999

levels.title: Leaked Access Logs
levels.description: Dumpster dive the Internet for a leaked password and log in to the original user account it belongs to. (Creating a new account with the same password does not qualify as a solution.)
levels.hint:
Once you have it, a technique called "Password Spraying" might prove useful.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#dumpster-dive-the-internet-for-a-leaked-password-and-log-in-to-the-original-user-account-it-belongs-to

levels.title: Leaked Unsafe Product
levels.description: Identify an unsafe product that was removed from the shop and inform the shop which ingredients are dangerous.
levels.hint:
Your own SQLi and someone else's Ctrl-V will be your accomplices in this challenge!
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#identify-an-unsafe-product-that-was-removed-from-the-shop-and-inform-the-shop-which-ingredients-are-dangerous

levels.title: Legacy Typosquatting
levels.description: Inform the shop about a typosquatting trick it has been a victim of at least in v6.2.0-SNAPSHOT. (Mention the exact name of the culprit)
levels.hint:
This challenge has nothing to do with mistyping web domains. Investigate the forgotten developer's backup file instead.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/vulnerable-components.html#inform-the-shop-about-a-typosquatting-trick-it-has-been-a-victim-of

levels.title: Login Admin
levels.description: Log in with the administrator's user account.
levels.hint:
Try different SQL Injection attack patterns depending whether you know the admin's email address or not.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#log-in-with-the-administrators-user-account

levels.title: Login Amy
levels.description: Log in with Amy's original user credentials. (This could take 93.83 billion trillion trillion centuries to brute force, but luckily she did not read the "One Important Final Note")
levels.hint:
This challenge will make you go after a needle in a haystack.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#log-in-with-amys-original-user-credentials

levels.title: Login Bender
levels.description: Log in with Bender's user account.
levels.hint:
If you know Bender's email address, try SQL Injection. Bender's password hash might not help you very much.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#log-in-with-benders-user-account

levels.title: Login Bjoern
levels.description: Log in with Bjoern's Gmail account without previously changing his password, applying SQL Injection, or hacking his Google account.
levels.hint:
The security flaw behind this challenge is 100% OWASP Juice Shop's fault and 0% Google's.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-authentication.html#log-in-with-bjoerns-gmail-account

levels.title: Login CISO
levels.description: Exploit OAuth 2.0 to log in with the Chief Information Security Officer's user account.
levels.hint:
Don't try to beat Google's OAuth 2.0 service. Rather investigate implementation flaws on OWASP Juice Shop's end.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-authentication.html#exploit-oauth-20-to-log-in-with-the-cisos-user-account

levels.title: Login Jim
levels.description: Log in with Jim's user account.
levels.hint:
Try cracking Jim's password hash if you harvested it already. Alternatively, if you know Jim's email address, try SQL Injection.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#log-in-with-jims-user-account

levels.title: Login MC SafeSearch
levels.description: Log in with MC SafeSearch's original user credentials without applying SQL Injection or any other bypass.
levels.hint:
You should listen to MC's hit song "Protect Ya Passwordz".
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#log-in-with-mc-safesearchs-original-user-credentials

levels.title: Login Support Team
levels.description: Log in with the support team's original user credentials without applying SQL Injection or any other bypass.
levels.hint:
The underlying flaw of this challenge is a lot more human error than technical weakness.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/security-misconfiguration.html#log-in-with-the-support-teams-original-user-credentials

levels.title: Manipulate Basket
levels.description: Put an additional product into another user's shopping basket.
levels.hint:
Have an eye on the HTTP traffic while placing products in the shopping basket. Changing the quantity of products already in the basket doesn't count.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-access-control.html#put-an-additional-product-into-another-users-shopping-basket

levels.title: Misplaced Signature File
levels.description: Access a misplaced SIEM signature file.
levels.hint:
You need to trick a security mechanism into thinking that the file you want has a valid file type.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#access-a-misplaced-siem-signature-file

levels.title: Multiple Likes
levels.description: Like any review at least three times as the same user.
levels.hint:
Punctuality is the politeness of kings.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-anti-automation.html#like-any-review-at-least-three-times-as-the-same-user

levels.title: Nested Easter Egg
levels.description: Apply some advanced cryptanalysis to find the real easter egg.
levels.hint:
You might have to peel through several layers of tough-as-nails encryption for this challenge.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/cryptographic-issues.html#apply-some-advanced-cryptanalysis-to-find-the-real-easter-egg

levels.title: NoSQL DoS
levels.description: Let the server sleep for some time. (It has done more than enough hard work for you) (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
This challenge is essentially a stripped-down Denial of Service (DoS) attack.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#let-the-server-sleep-for-some-time

levels.title: NoSQL Exfiltration
levels.description: All your orders are belong to us! Even the ones which don't. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
Take a close look on how the $where query operator works in MongoDB.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#all-your-orders-are-belong-to-us

levels.title: NoSQL Manipulation
levels.description: Update multiple product reviews at the same time.
levels.hint:
Take a close look on how the equivalent of UPDATE-statements in MongoDB work.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#update-multiple-product-reviews-at-the-same-time

levels.title: Outdated Whitelist
levels.description: Let us redirect you to one of our crypto currency addresses which are not promoted any longer.
levels.hint:
We might have failed to take this out of our code properly.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/unvalidated-redirects.html#let-us-redirect-you-to-one-of-our-crypto-currency-addresses

levels.title: Password Strength
levels.description: Log in with the administrator's user credentials without previously changing them or applying SQL Injection.
levels.hint:
This one should be equally easy to a) brute force, b) crack the password hash or c) simply guess.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-authentication.html#log-in-with-the-administrators-user-credentials-without-previously-changing-them-or-applying-sql-injection

levels.title: Payback Time
levels.description: Place an order that makes you rich.
levels.hint:
You literally need to make the shop owe you any amount of money.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/improper-input-validation.html#place-an-order-that-makes-you-rich

levels.title: Premium Paywall
levels.description: Unlock Premium Challenge to access exclusive content.
levels.hint:
You do not have to pay anything to unlock this challenge! Nonetheless, donations are very much appreciated.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/cryptographic-issues.html#unlock-premium-challenge-to-access-exclusive-content

levels.title: Privacy Policy
levels.description: Read our privacy policy.
levels.hint:
We won't even ask you to confirm that you did. Just read it. Please. Pretty please.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/miscellaneous.html#read-our-privacy-policy

levels.title: Privacy Policy Inspection
levels.description: Prove that you actually read our privacy policy.
levels.hint:
Only by visiting a special URL you can confirm that you read it carefully.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/security-through-obscurity.html#prove-that-you-actually-read-our-privacy-policy

levels.title: Product Tampering
levels.description: Change the href of the link within the OWASP SSL Advanced Forensic Tool (O-Saft) product description into https://owasp.slack.com.
levels.hint:
Look for one of the following: a) broken admin functionality, b) holes in RESTful API or c) possibility for SQL Injection.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-access-control.html#change-the-href-of-the-link-within-the-o-saft-product-description

levels.title: Reflected XSS
levels.description: Perform a reflected XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)">. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
Look for a url parameter where its value appears in the page it is leading to.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xss.html#perform-a-reflected-xss-attack

levels.title: Repetitive Registration
levels.description: Follow the DRY principle while registering a user.
levels.hint:
You can solve this by cleverly interacting with the UI or bypassing it altogether.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/improper-input-validation.html#follow-the-dry-principle-while-registering-a-user

levels.title: Reset Bender's Password
levels.description: Reset Bender's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
Not as trivial as Jim's but still not too difficult with some "Futurama" background knowledge.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-authentication.html#reset-benders-password-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism

levels.title: Reset Bjoern's Password
levels.description: Reset the password of Bjoern's internal account via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
Nothing a little bit of Facebook stalking couldn't reveal. Might involve a historical twist.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-authentication.html#reset-the-password-of-bjoerns-internal-account-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism

levels.title: Reset Jim's Password
levels.description: Reset Jim's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
It's hard for celebrities to pick a security question from a hard-coded list where the answer is not publicly exposed.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-authentication.html#reset-jims-password-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism

levels.title: Reset Morty's Password
levels.description: Reset Morty's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with his obfuscated answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
Find a way to bypass the rate limiting and brute force the obfuscated answer to Morty's security question.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-anti-automation.html#reset-mortys-password-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism

levels.title: Retrieve Blueprint
levels.description: Deprive the shop of earnings by downloading the blueprint for one of its products.
levels.hint:
The product you might want to give a closer look is the OWASP Juice Shop Logo (3D-printed).
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#deprive-the-shop-of-earnings-by-downloading-the-blueprint-for-one-of-its-products

levels.title: SSRF
levels.description: Request a hidden resource on server through server.
levels.hint:
Reverse engineering something bad can make good things happen.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-access-control.html#request-a-hidden-resource-on-server-through-server

levels.title: SSTi
levels.description: Infect the server with juicy malware by abusing arbitrary command execution. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
"SSTi" is a clear indicator that this has nothing to do with anything Angular. Also, make sure to use only our non-malicious malware.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#infect-the-server-with-juicy-malware-by-abusing-arbitrary-command-execution

levels.title: Score Board
levels.description: Find the carefully hidden 'Score Board' page.
levels.hint:
Try to find a reference or clue behind the scenes. Or simply guess what URL the Score Board might have.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/score-board.html#find-the-carefully-hidden-score-board-page

levels.title: Security Policy
levels.description: Behave like any "white-hat" should before getting into the action.
levels.hint:
Undoubtably you want to read our security policy before conducting any research on our application.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/miscellaneous.html#behave-like-any-white-hat-should-before-getting-into-the-action

levels.title: Server-side XSS Protection
levels.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> bypassing a server-side security mechanism. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
The "Comment" field in the "Customer Feedback" screen is where you want to put your focus on.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xss.html#perform-a-persisted-xss-attack-bypassing-a-server-side-security-mechanism

levels.title: Steganography
levels.description: Rat out a notorious character hiding in plain sight in the shop. (Mention the exact name of the character)
levels.hint:
No matter how good your eyes are, you will need tool assistance for this challenge.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/security-through-obscurity.html#rat-out-a-notorious-character-hiding-in-plain-sight-in-the-shop

levels.title: Successful RCE DoS
levels.description: Perform a Remote Code Execution that occupies the server for a while without using infinite loops. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
Your attack payload must not trigger the protection against too many iterations.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/insecure-deserialization.html#perform-a-remote-code-execution-that-occupies-the-server-for-a-while-without-using-infinite-loops

levels.title: Supply Chain Attack
levels.description: Inform the development team about a danger to some of their credentials. (Send them the URL of the original report or an assigned CVE or another identifier of this vulnerability)
levels.hint:
This vulnerability will not affect any customer of the shop. It is aimed exclusively at its developers.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/vulnerable-components.html#inform-the-development-team-about-a-danger-to-some-of-their-credentials

levels.title: Two Factor Authentication
levels.description: Solve the 2FA challenge for user "wurstbrot". (Disabling, bypassing or overwriting his 2FA settings does not count as a solution)
levels.hint:
The 2FA implementation requires to store a secret for every user. You will need to find a way to access this secret in order to solve this challenge.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-authentication.html#solve-the-2fa-challenge-for-user-wurstbrot

levels.title: Unsigned JWT
levels.description: Forge an essentially unsigned JWT token that impersonates the (non-existing) user jwtn3d@juice-sh.op.
levels.hint:
This challenge exploits a weird option that is supported when signing tokens with JWT.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/vulnerable-components.html#forge-an-essentially-unsigned-jwt-token

levels.title: Upload Size
levels.description: Upload a file larger than 100 kB.
levels.hint:
You can attach a small file to the "Complaint" form. Investigate how this upload actually works.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/improper-input-validation.html#upload-a-file-larger-than-100-kb

levels.title: Upload Type
levels.description: Upload a file that has no .pdf or .zip extension.
levels.hint:
You can attach a PDF or ZIP file to the "Complaint" form. Investigate how this upload actually works.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/improper-input-validation.html#upload-a-file-that-has-no-pdf-or-zip-extension

levels.title: User Credentials
levels.description: Retrieve a list of all user credentials via SQL Injection.
levels.hint:
Gather information on where user data is stored and how it is addressed. Then craft a corresponding UNION SELECT attack.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#retrieve-a-list-of-all-user-credentials-via-sql-injection

levels.title: Video XSS
levels.description: Embed an XSS payload </script><script>alert(`xss`)</script> into our promo video. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
You have to reuse the vulnerability behind one other 6-star challenge to be able to solve this one.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xss.html#embed-an-xss-payload-into-our-promo-video

levels.title: View Basket
levels.description: View another user's shopping basket.
levels.hint:
Have an eye on the HTTP traffic while shopping. Alternatively try to find a client-side association of users to their basket.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-access-control.html#view-another-users-shopping-basket

levels.title: Vulnerable Library
levels.description: Inform the shop about a vulnerable library it is using. (Mention the exact library name and version in your comment)
levels.hint:
Report one of two possible answers via the "Customer Feedback" form. Do not forget to submit the library's version as well.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/vulnerable-components.html#inform-the-shop-about-a-vulnerable-library-it-is-using

levels.title: Weird Crypto
levels.description: Inform the shop about an algorithm or library it should definitely not use the way it does.
levels.hint:
Report one of four possible answers via the "Customer Feedback" form.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/cryptographic-issues.html#inform-the-shop-about-an-algorithm-or-library-it-should-definitely-not-use-the-way-it-does

levels.title: Whitelist Bypass
levels.description: Enforce a redirect to a page you are not supposed to redirect to.
levels.hint:
You have to find a way to beat the whitelist of allowed redirect URLs.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/unvalidated-redirects.html#enforce-a-redirect-to-a-page-you-are-not-supposed-to-redirect-to

levels.title: XXE Data Access
levels.description: Retrieve the content of C:\Windows\system.ini or /etc/passwd from the server. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
The leverage point for this challenge is the deprecated B2B interface.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xxe.html#retrieve-the-content-of-cwindowssystemini-or-etcpasswd-from-the-server

levels.title: XXE DoS
levels.description: Give the server something to chew on for quite a while. (This challenge is not available on Heroku!)
levels.hint:
It is not as easy as sending a large amount of data directly to the deprecated B2B interface.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xxe.html#give-the-server-something-to-chew-on-for-quite-a-while

levels.title: Zero Stars
levels.description: Give a devastating zero-star feedback to the store.
levels.hint:
Before you invest time bypassing the API, you might want to play around with the UI a bit.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/improper-input-validation.html#give-a-devastating-zero-star-feedback-to-the-store

levels.title: Missing Encoding
levels.description: Retrieve the photo of Bjoern's cat in "melee combat-mode".
levels.hint:
Check the Photo Wall for an image that could not be loaded correctly.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/improper-input-validation.html#retrieve-the-photo-of-bjoerns-cat-in-melee-combat-mode

levels.title: Cross-Site Imaging
levels.description: Stick cute cross-domain kittens all over our delivery boxes.
levels.hint:
This challenge would formally have to be in several categories as the developers made multiple gaffes for this to be possible.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/injection.html#stick-cute-cross-domain-kittens-all-over-our-delivery-boxes

levels.title: Exposed Metrics
levels.description: Find the endpoint that serves usage data to be scraped by a popular monitoring system.
levels.hint:
Try to guess what URL the endpoint might have.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#find-the-endpoint-that-serves-usage-data-to-be-scraped-by-a-popular-monitoring-system

levels.title: Deluxe Fraud
levels.description: Obtain a Deluxe Membership without paying for it.
levels.hint:
Look closely at what happens when you attempt to upgrade your account.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/improper-input-validation.html#obtain-a-deluxe-membership-without-paying-for-it

levels.title: CSRF
levels.description: Change the name of a user by performing Cross-Site Request Forgery from another origin.
levels.hint:
Find a form which updates the username and then construct a malicious page in the online HTML editor.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/broken-access-control.html#change-the-name-of-a-user-by-performing-cross-site-request-forgery-from-another-origin

levels.title: Bonus Payload
levels.description: Use the bonus payload <iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" allow="autoplay" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=https%3A//api.soundcloud.com/tracks/771984076&color=%23ff5500&auto_play=true&hide_related=false&show_comments=true&show_user=true&show_reposts=false&show_teaser=true"></iframe> in the DOM XSS challenge.
levels.hint:
Copy + Paste = Solved!
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/xss.html#use-the-bonus-payload-in-the-dom-xss-challenge

levels.title: Reset Uvogin's Password
levels.description: Reset Uvogin's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
levels.hint:
You might have to do some OSINT on his social media personas to find out his honest answer to the security question.
https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/part2/sensitive-data-exposure.html#reset-uvogins-password-via-the-forgot-password-mechanism
